pullRequest.body:
We prove that a map out of the one point compactification of `X` is continuous if and only if its restriction to `X` satisfies the two properties
1) is continuous
2) is continuous "at infinity", namely that it tends to the value at infinity for the `coclosedCompact`¬†filter on `X`

We deduce that continuous functions out of the one point compactification of the natural numbers correspond to convergent sequences. 

We also prove that the one point compactification of a discrete space is totally separated. 

Co-authored-by: Jireh Loreaux

---
This is all in preparation for the definition of `‚Ñï ‚à™ {‚àû}` as a light profinite set, which is important in light condensed mathematics.

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body:
Can you add a `def` that allows to extend a continuous function from `X` to a continuous from `OnePoint X` (given the relevant condition)? We probably also want unicity.

More generally, is there a universal property I think (I don't know in which category), sooner or later we will want that.

The universal property should be something like `CocompactMap`s on `X` extend uniquely to `ContinuousMap`s on `OnePoint X`, if I'm not mistaken. (probably you need Hausdorff because currently `CocompactMap` only uses the `cocompact` filter, not the `coclosedCompact` filter in its definition; this may be an oversight that we should change, I'm not sure.)

That is, there should probably be something like `CocompactMap X Y ‚âÉ C(OnePoint X, Y)`.

I added some constructors which take a continuous map and a "limit value" and produce a continuous map from `OnePoint`. For the universal property suggested by Jireh we would either need a new structure `CoclosedcompactMap` or something like that, or refactor the definition of `CocompactMap`¬†

### PR summary [9dfbf9a24e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13355/commits/9dfbf9a24e375560bd6b387b0d2d34948b3cde6f)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ continuousMapDiscreteEquiv`
`+ continuousMapMk`
`+ continuousMapMkDiscrete`
`+ continuousMapMkNat`
`+ continuousMapNatEquiv`
`+ continuous_iff`
`+ continuous_iff_from_discrete`
`+ continuous_iff_from_nat`
`+ instance (X : Type*) [TopologicalSpace X] [DiscreteTopology X] :`
`+ ¬´exists¬ª`
`+ ¬´forall¬ª`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

</details>
Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9536644559/job/26283826170)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9536644559/job/26283826372)
The `@coe` tag in the previous def does not seem to fire, why cannot we simply write `x : OnePoint X` to mean `some x : OnePoint X`?
It works after the `CoeTC`

```suggestion
  simp only [continuous_iff_continuousAt, OnePoint.forall, continuousAt_coe, continuousAt_infty']
  rfl
```
Not sure that `of_nat` is the right name. What about `_from_nat`?

Well we have [docs#continuous_of_discreteTopology](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Order.html#continuous_of_discreteTopology), so this is consistent with that. But I agree that `from`¬†would be clearer
I've decided I like `from`¬†better

```suggestion
  toFun f := ‚ü®(f ¬∑), ‚ü®f ‚àû, continuous_iff_from_discrete _ |>.mp (map_continuous f)‚ü©‚ü©
```

```suggestion
    C(OnePoint ‚Ñï, Y) ‚âÉ { f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí Y // ‚àÉ L, Tendsto (f ¬∑) atTop (ùìù L) } := by
```
